description: Sixteen departments have been placed on red alert, the highest level of warning, and 68 on orange alert as France faces the peak of a lengthy heatwave, which has already lasted 13 days.

Trump dismantles Syria sanctions program as Israel eyes ties with new leadership
description: The US president hopes to reintegrate Syria into the global economy as Israel considers normalizing ties with the country. The orders still maintain sanctions on elements of the former government, including Assad.

headline: In Switzerland, an F-35 fighter jet deal has turned into a national scandal
description: The purchase of 36 next-generation American fighter jets will cost far more than the six billion Swiss francs initially announced in 2022. They might also be delivered under-equipped in terms of weaponry.

headline: 'As Luca de Meo abandons ship, Renault's future remains highly uncertain'
description: The CEO of the French automaker will join the luxury group Kering in September. The Italian executive is known for turning around struggling companies, and though he reshaped the automobile brand sometimes for the better, it was more often toward the unknown, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

headline: Israel limits entry of baby formula in Gaza as infants die of hunger
description: While waiting to enter Gaza on a medical aid mission, an American doctor watched Israeli security forces confiscate the cans of powdered baby formula packed in his luggage. The vital product is desperately lacking in the Palestinian enclave, where about 50 children have died of hunger since March.

description: Although long considered the best-protected city in Ukraine, the capital has not been spared from a surge in bombardments now affecting the entire country.

headline: The young women enlisting in Ukraine's army: 'In the army, you have to show you've got balls!'
description: Lialia, Veronika and Alina are three women aged 19-24 who have signed up to defend their country. They told Le Monde about their daily lives, what motivates them and the challenges they sometimes face working in such a male-dominated environment.

headline: 'Queer people have always existed in the countryside': The spread of Pride marches beyond France's big cities
description: After years of LGBTQIA+ activism being concentrated in bigger French cities, more and more rural Pride events are emerging, from small villages to mid-sized towns. Le Monde spoke with several organizations involved in this movement.
